sectionOne.title: Covid-19?
sectionOne.text: COVID-19 is the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus*. This new virus and disease were unknown before the outbreak began in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. COVID-19 is now a pandemic affecting many countries globally. *Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans.  In humans, several coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). The most recently discovered coronavirus causes coronavirus disease COVID-19.

sectionTwo.title: Spread?
sectionTwo.text: People can catch COVID-19 from others who have the virus. The disease spreads primarily from person to person through

card1.title: Droplets
card1.text: Small droplets from the nose or mouth, which are expelled when a person with COVID-19 coughs, sneezes, or speaks.

card2.title: Objects & surfaces
card2.text: These droplets can land on objects and surfaces around the person such as tables, doorknobs and handrails. People can become infected by touching these objects or surfaces, then touching their eyes, nose or mouth

card3.title: Close contact
card3.text: You can be infected by breathing the virus if you are near a sick person
